events.name: Detroit Lions at Kansas City Chiefs

headlines.description: — The Lions walked into roaring Arrowhead Stadium on Thursday night, where the Kansas City Chiefs are nearly unbeatable and were trying to open their latest Super Bowl title defense with a win, and proved what Detroit coach Dan Campbell has come to...
headlines.shortLinkText: Lions spoil Chiefs' celebration of Super Bowl title by rallying for a 21-20 win in the NFL's opener

headlines.description: — The Cleveland Browns took Ja'Marr Chase's trash talk personally.
headlines.shortLinkText: Deshaun Watson runs for TD, Browns bottle up Joe Burrow in 24-3 win over Bengals in season opener

headlines.description: — Tank Bigsby had the perfect response for his rookie mistake.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bigsby makes amends for big mistake by helping Jags earn rare 31-21 victory at Indy

events.name: Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Minnesota Vikings
Tennessee Titans at New Orleans Saints

headlines.description: — After taking four sacks, throwing an interception and being flattened by a forearm to the face, a sore but determined Derek Carr pulled out the kind of finish he wanted in his New Orleans Saints debut.
headlines.shortLinkText: Derek Carr's New Orleans debut is a success as the Saints edge the Titans 16-15

headlines.description: — Brock Purdy spent months rehabbing his surgically repaired right elbow and an entire training camp wondering if he could regain the magic he...
headlines.shortLinkText: Purdy throws 2 TDs in return from elbow surgery; 49ers drill Steelers 30-7 in season opener

headlines.description: — Throughout the second half, Montez Sweat looked around at his defensive teammates and asked who was going to be the closer the Washington Commanders needed.
headlines.shortLinkText: Washington's defense takes over to help the Commanders rally past the Cardinals 20-16

headlines.description: — With J.K. Dobbins lost for the season because of a torn Achilles tendon, the Baltimore Ravens are again facing some major questions about...
headlines.shortLinkText: Ravens beat Texans 25-9, but will be without running back J.K. Dobbins for the rest of the season

events.name: Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears

headlines.description: — Jordan Love kept telling himself he and his teammates were going to play great. He imagined how it would feel to leave the field with a win, too.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jordan Love delivers in opener, throws 3 TD passes as Packers beat Bears 38-20

events.name: Las Vegas Raiders at Denver Broncos

headlines.description: — Change the coaches and switch the quarterbacks, the Raiders still own the Broncos.
headlines.shortLinkText: Garoppolo and Meyers spoil Payton's Denver debut in Raiders' 7th straight win over Broncos

events.name: Philadelphia Eagles at New England Patriots

headlines.description: — Jalen Hurts walked off the field following the Eagles' season-opening victory unsure of what the offense he leads can achieve this season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jalen Hurts, Eagles build early lead, hang on to beat Patriots 25-20 as Tom Brady is honored

events.name: Miami Dolphins at Los Angeles Chargers

headlines.description: — Tua Tagovailoa might have shocked some observers by putting up one of the best passing days in an opener in NFL history.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hill, Tagovailoa too much for Chargers as Dolphins open with 36-34 victory

events.name: Los Angeles Rams at Seattle Seahawks

headlines.description: — Matthew Stafford started the season without his favorite target, with a rebuilt and unproven offensive line, and with an outside narrative that the ceiling for the Los Angeles Rams this season is just being competitive.
headlines.shortLinkText: Rams show they can be more than competitive and thump Seahawks 30-13 in season opener

events.name: Dallas Cowboys at New York Giants

headlines.description: — The Dallas Cowboys have not only put some distance between themselves and the New York Giants in the NFC East, they showed Sunday night they are going to be a contender for more than a division title.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cowboys rip error-prone Giants 40-0 for worst shutout loss in the series between NFC East rivals

events.name: Buffalo Bills at New York Jets

headlines.description: — The New York Jets pulled off one of their most exciting and unlikely victories in years — and still couldn't completely enjoy it.
headlines.shortLinkText: Jets lose Aaron Rodgers to an Achilles tendon injury, then rally to stun Bills 22-16 in overtime
